page.title: 14MULLION PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Mullion Parish Church was largely built between 1200 and 1300AD. At first it was small, but as the number of practising Christians grew, it was extended. Sir Robert Ludra built the bell tower, which houses 6 bells, in the early 16th century. He also commissioned the carving of the sides of the oak benches and the seat rails, which depict the instruments of the passion. All the windows have been replaced by modern stained glass. There are usually 5 services each week, 2 of which are on Sundays. The average size of the congregation is between 80 and 90, increasing in the summer due to tourists.The church can hold 200 people.In 1984 there were 6 weddings annd 4 funerals.In 1912 the churchyard was officially closed for burials, though in 1985 there still remains space for cremated remains.
